title: A Year After Ethereum Merge, Net Supply Down Nearly 300K Ether - CoinDesk
content: "While Ethereum is 'down' it is certainly not 'out' and Ether investors should slowly monitor any positive news flow around the EIP-4844 upgrade. But a lot is at 'stake'; if this upgrade is seen as another minimal improvement, then the best days might be behind Ethereum," Thielen said, noting the increase in Ethereum's monthly transactions from 28 million to 32 million since the Merge.

title: Ethereum Blockchain Launches 'Holesky' Test Network, on First Anniversary of Historic 'Merge' - Yahoo Finance
content:
Ethereum developers launched a new test network, Holesky, on Friday that they say will improve the largest smart-contracts blockchain’s testing capability – by making it twice as big, at least based on one metric, than the main network.

The first blocks proposed on the new test network were visible on Friday via a new blockchain explorer set up specifically to monitor Holesky, on the website beaconcha.in.

The launch of Holesky was selected to mark the first anniversary of Ethereum completing the "Merge," its historic transition to a "proof-of-stake" blockchain, from the original and more energy-hungry "proof-of-work" model that Bitcoin uses.

Testnets are copies of a blockchain – in this case Ethereum – used specifically for testing new applications and smart contracts in a low-stakes environment.

Ethereum developers expect Holesky to eventually replace the Goerli testnet, targeted for sunset in early 2024.

Biggest testnet for Ethereum

Ethereum core developer Parithosh Jayanthi told CoinDesk that Holesky is expected to become the biggest testnet for Ethereum, and should have 1.4 million validators to help address scalability problems with mainnet. That's double the 700,000 on Ethereum.

Goerli and Sepolia, another Ethereum testnet, are operated by a smaller subset of “validators” than the main Ethereum chain, and some developers think these smaller validator sets pose a problem.

By making Holesky bigger, developers will theoretically be able to test infrastructure and upgrades under more rigorous conditions, meaning tests that go smoothly on Holesky should be less likely to face unforeseen issues on mainnet.

“We don't want to hit a scaling issue that could happen first on mainnet,” Jayanthi told CoinDesk prior to Holesky's debut. “We want to catch [scaling issues] on testnet, which means we have to have a testnet that's bigger” than the main Ethereum chain.

Read more: Hello Holesky, Ethereum’s Newest Testnet

title: Charting a New Path in DeFi: Everlodge (ELDG) Rises, Eclipsing Ethereum (ETH) and Solana (SOL) - The Economic Times
content:
Everlodge (ELDG), now in its presale phase, is carving an impressive path that makes it stand shoulder-to-shoulder with established giants Ethereum (ETH) and Solana (SOL). This piece delves into the journey of Everlodge, outlining its rise and the potential to reshape the future of DeFi.

Join the Everlodge presale

Everlodge (ELDG): An 80% Price Surge and Global Anticipation

With just $100, you could own a stake in an upscale New York hotel, a coveted Airbnb in London's center, or a serene Maldivian villa. But how is this possible?

The Everlodge vision is to transmute these properties into divisible NFTs available for trade on the blockchain, making high-end real estate investments accessible to many without hefty initial investments.

Anchored on the Ethereum blockchain, these NFTs embody trust, clarity, genuineness, and an unmatched level of investor authority. Notably, the NFT metadata encapsulates every critical property detail to avoid the limitations of traditional real estate investments.

Everlodge's idea is a game-changing one. Its potential lies in that real estate investments usually limited to investors with deep pockets, can now be purchased as fractional shares at low prices. Thus, Everlodge allows smaller-sized investors to benefit from the industry's growth without paying exorbitant fees or settling for lower returns.

The fervor surrounding Everlodge's presale is palpable, with millions of investors clamoring for the last remaining ELDG tokens selling for $0.018 in phase 3. The current price represents an 80% pump as the price rises throughout the presale event.

Given that the vacation rental market is valued at a staggering $82.6 billion and is poised for a 4.7% CAGR from 2023-2030, change is unmistakably in the wind. The upside for Everlodge is immense, prompting early investors to look at the project's promise in anticipation.

Analysts project Everlodge not merely as a participant but potentially as a game-changer in the real estate landscape, with whispers of ELDG's value skyrocketing by a whopping 30x once the full platform launches.

Ethereum (ETH)'s Fluctuations between $2,000 and $2,100

Over the past few months, Ethereum has attempted to break free from the $2,000 to $2,100 range. However, a swift 12% descent over the past few weeks to the $1,600 level has further dampened Ethereum's momentum.

So, what's curbing Ethereum's potential? Despite its strong fundamentals and a $21 billion TVL, Ethereum remains chained to Bitcoin's price movements. As Bitcoin grapples with its own market hurdles, Ethereum is caught in the ensuing ripple effect, leading traders to seek more stable grounds.

But the Bitcoin link is just one facet. Diminishing network activity and looming apprehensions of massive sell-offs further darken the horizon. This sentiment is mirrored in Ethereum's TVL, which witnessed a sharp 50% drop since mid-April.

Yet, for Ethereum's major stakeholders, the landscape isn't entirely bleak. Many draw parallels between the early promise they saw in Ethereum in 2017 and the potential they now see in Everlodge. This budding interest, amplified by the enticing offers in the Everlodge presale, is steering Ethereum traders to venture into this emerging realm.

Solana (SOL): Shifting Investor Focus to New Horizons like Everlodge (ELDG)

Solana's price recently surged from $8 to an admirable $32. A combination of factors fueled this ascent: Solana's recovery from the FTX debacle, the success of the Ripple/SEC legal case, and its ability to overcome minor technical glitches that once dampened its appeal.

However, despite this strong trajectory, Solana could not breach the $32 resistance point. Its current standing at $18.95 marks a considerable 40% slide in just two months. While analysts hold the conviction that the $16 mark offers staunch support, the precipitous drop undeniably jolted the faith of Solana enthusiasts.

Yet, experts continue to spotlight Solana's promise as a frontrunner in layer-1 technology and the DeFi realm. Since the year's outset, the platform's 50% augmentation in TVL is a testament to its bullish prospects.

That said, it's undeniable that Solana, much like its counterparts, has been swayed by the overarching bearish market mood. Consequently, some investors are setting their sights on fresher prospects, with Everlodge emerging as a shining beacon in the darkness.

Find out more about the Everlodge (ELDG) Presale

Website: https://www.everlodge.io/

Telegram: https://t.me/everlodge

Disclaimer:
